title: Business Development Officer Job at Natafamdavid Consulting Nigeria Limited
content:
Natafamdavid Consulting Nigeria Limited is a business growth consultancy company offering tailor made services targeted at building profitable and productive companies with a focus on building sustainable enterprises, comprehensive HR advisory services, brand growth, corporate governance, business strategy and advisory services at different sections of the value chain.

Our services are across-the-board and we are driven by a strong passion to create value for our clients. From the het go, we set out to work with clients across diverse industries, providing strategic solutions to increase our success matrix, productivity, profitability.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Business Development Officer
Job Location: Ikeja, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsiblilites


	Identify and pursue new business opportunities to increase restaurant revenue

title: Life Underwriter Job at Fortis Global Insurance Plc
content:
Fortis Global Insurance Plc. ’FGI’ is a dynamic and innovative force poised to redefine the insurance landscape in Nigeria. We are driven by a singular vision: to deliver unparalleled value and a seamless experience to every customer.

At FGI, we believe the future of insurance is intelligent, intuitive, and deeply personal. We are built from the ground up as a technology-driven enterprise, leveraging cutting-edge solutions to simplify complex processes, enhance accessibility, and provide swift, reliable service. Our digital-first approach ensures that managing the insurance needs of our clients is effortless, secure, and always at their fingertips.
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Life Underwriter
Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Department: Underwriting
Reports to: Head of Underwriting

Job Summary


	The Life Underwriter is responsible for evaluating life insurance applications and determining the risk eligibility of applicants in line with company policies and regulatory requirements.
	This role involves analyzing medical report, financial, occupational, and lifestyle information to assess mortality risk and ensure sound underwriting decisions that align with the company’s risk appetite and profitability goals.


Key Responsibilities


	Review and assess life insurance applications for completeness and accuracy.
	Evaluate risk based on medical history, financial background, lifestyle, and occupation using underwriting guidelines and automated systems.
	Interpret medical reports, attending physician statements (APS), lab results, and paramedical exams.
	Maintain up-to-date knowledge of underwriting guidelines, medical advancements, and regulatory changes.
	Ensure compliance with internal policies, industry standards, and legal requirements.
	Assist in training junior underwriters and supporting underwriting audits, if applicable.
	Make accurate decisions regarding approval, rating, postponement, or denial of life insurance applications within assigned authority limits.
	Collaborate with reinsurance partners for facultative underwriting cases.
	Communicate effectively with agents, brokers, and internal stakeholders to clarify underwriting decisions.
	Contribute to continuous improvement in underwriting practices and risk assessment tools.


Qualifications and Experience


	Bachelor’s degree in insurance, business, health sciences, or related field.
	Minimum 3-5 years of experience in life insurance underwriting.
	Certification or working toward a professional designation
	Strong understanding of medical terminology, underwriting guidelines, and mortality risk factors.
	Experience working with automated underwriting systems and reinsurance platforms.
	Excellent analytical, decision-making, and organizational skills.
	Strong verbal and written communication abilities.
	Attention to detail and ability to work independently and under pressure.


Key Competencies:


	Risk Assessment
	Medical & Financial Analysis
	Communication & Interpersonal Skills
	Confidentiality & Professionalism
	Decision-Making
	Regulatory Compliance
	Customer Focus
	Team Collaboration.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send a copy of their updated CV to: recruitment@fortisglobalinsurance.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

title: Junior Product Manager Job at Co Creation Hub
content:
CcHUB is Nigeria’s first open living lab and pre-incubation space being designed to be a multi-functional, multi-purpose space where work to catalyze creative social tech ventures take place. The HUB is a place for technologists, social entrepreneurs, government, tech companies, impact investors and hackers in and around Lagos to co-create new solutions to the many social problems in Nigeria.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Junior Product Manager

Job Location: Lagos
Job type: Full-time

Job Purpose
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	As a Junior PM you will be responsible for assisting the Product team in developing and managing the teams suite of products.
	You will be in charge of coming up with ideas or strategies that improve products as well as increase its user base.


Key Responsibilities


	Collaborate with engineering and design teams to define and deliver high-quality products.
	Prepare and maintain clear Product Requirement Documents (PRDs), user flows, and detailed specifications.
	Translate product vision into actionable requirements that align with business objectives.
	Analyze user data, conduct market research, and identify opportunities for product improvement.
	Plan and execute usability tests to uncover product issues and track performance.
	Coordinate feedback across teams, ensuring alignment between product direction and company goals.
	Partner with marketing to develop strategies that drive product adoption and engagement.
	Gather and interpret customer feedback to inform product decisions and prioritize feature enhancements.


Qualifications
Key Competencies:


	Educational Background: Holds a B.Sc degree in Computer Science, a scientific discipline, or a related field.
	Industry Experience: At least 2 years of experience as a Product Manager, specifically within a SaaS environment.
	Foundational Knowledge in Product Management: Completed formal training or courses in product management principles and practices.
	Team Collaboration: Experience working within cross-functional product teams, contributing to end-to-end product development.
	Hands-On Product Development: Practical experience in building and launching software products, with a clear understanding of the product lifecycle.
	Project Management & Execution: Strong project management skills with a keen attention to detail and ability to manage timelines and deliverables.
	Process & UX Mindset: Demonstrates a strong focus on efficiency, user experience, and continuous process improvement.
	Communication Skills: Excellent verbal and written communication skills in English, with the ability to clearly convey complex ideas to diverse audiences.
	Domain Knowledge (added advantage): Experience in EdTech or the education sector is an added advantage.

title: Tax Manager, Africa Job at Zipline
content:
Zipline - Do you want to change the world? Zipline uses drones to deliver critical and life-saving medicine to thousands of hospitals serving millions of people in multiple countries. Our mission is to provide every human on Earth with instant access to vital medical supplies. Join Zipline and help us make this a reality for billions of people.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Tax Manager, Africa

Job Location: Lagos
Job Schedule: Full-time

About You and the Role  
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are looking for a hands-on, motivated Tax Manager to manage all African country taxes. We are located in Cote D’Ivoire, Ghana, Kenya, Nigeria, and Rwanda. You will manage all taxes (excluding payroll taxes) in these countries to ensure they’re accurately and timely filed. You will collaborate with the Accounting and Finance team to ensure tax-related accounts are correctly reflected in the financials. 
	You will perform reviews of the income tax provision for statutory financial reporting and corporate income tax returns. 
	You will collaborate with local Accounting and Finance leads on tax audits. 
	As our key tax person, you will continue to look for ways to increase efficiency in the tax processes without sacrificing quality while looking for ways to minimize our taxes through thoughtful tax planning ideas. 
	The Africa Tax Manager will report to the Head of Tax with a dotted line to African Country Controller. The Africa Tax Manager will serve as the Tax Lead for all African countries. 


What You'll Do
The Africa Tax Manager will perform the following duties:


	Prepare VAT and other indirect tax returns for all African countries
	Prepare monthly tax account reconciliations
	Prepare audit ready tax workpapers and documentation
	Prepare and manage quarterly Corporate Income Tax (CIT) tax declarations and any required payments
	Gather documentation and manage all (CIT) returns to ensure returns are accurately and timely filed by external tax preparers
	Manage African countries tax calendar to ensure timely filing of all tax returns and declarations
	Collaborate with local accounting and finance leads to manage tax audits 
	Collaborate with the Accounting and Finance teams to address all tax related matters
	Review annual income tax provision calculations
	Assist in preparing and reviewing transfer pricing calculations
	Review and monitor intercompany transactions for tax implications
	Provide tax consultation and training to other business functions
	Provide tax development and updates to the Head of Tax and other business functions
	Liaise and manage relationship with outside tax advisors
	Collaborate with Head of Tax to develop and implement tax planning ideas
	Continue to enhance and improve internal control in the tax area
	Support other countries outside of Africa as needed


Requirements
What You'll Bring:


	Candidates should a Bachelor's Degree Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Finance, or related field
	At least 7 years of tax experience working with a multinational company with operations in various African countries and/or similar experience from an international public accounting firm
	Graduate degree or professional certification is a plus 
	Strong analytical, problem-solving and organizational skills
	Excellent communication (oral and written) and interpersonal skills
	Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and willing to work outside of business hours with colleagues overseas primarily in the USA
	Proficient with software such as Microsoft Officer Suite and/or Google G Suite specifically Excel and Google Sheet.
